1. The training rule on body hair in private

original: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
analyzed: tena samayena buddhaḥ bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme
translated: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

original: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo sambādhe lomaṁ saṁharāpetvā aciravatiyā nadiyā vesiyāhi saddhiṁ naggā ekatitthe nahāyanti.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyāḥ bhikkhuniyaḥ sambādhe lomam saharāpetvā aciravatiyāḥ nadiyāḥ vesiyāhi saddhim naggāḥ ekatitthe nahāyanti
translated: at that time the nuns from the group of six had body hair removed in private. They then bathed naked at the same bathing place as the courtesans of the Kāsi people on the banks of the river Vaggumudā.
The courtesans complained and criticized them,

original: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhuniyo sambādhe lomaṁ saṁharāpessanti, seyyathāpi gihiniyo kāmabhoginiyo”ti.🔽Assosuṁ kho bhikkhuniyo tāsaṁ vesiyānaṁ ujjhāyantīnaṁ khiyyantīnaṁ vipācentīnaṁ.
analyzed: katham hi nāma bhikkhuniyaḥ sambādhe lomam saharāpessanti seyyathā api gihiniyaḥ kāmabhoginiyaḥ ti  assosum kho bhikkhuniyaḥ tāsam vesiyānam ujjhāyantīnam khiyyantīnam vipācentīnam
translated: “How can the nuns have body hair removed in private? They are just like householders who indulge in worldly pleasures!”🔽The nuns heard the complaints of those courtesans,

original: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
analyzed: yāḥ tāḥ bhikkhuniyaḥ appicchāḥ pe tāḥ ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti
translated: and the nuns of few desires complained and criticized those nuns,🔽“How can the nuns from the group of six have body hair removed in private?” …

original: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo sambādhe lomaṁ saṁharāpessantī”ti …pe…
analyzed: katham hi nāma chabbaggiyāḥ bhikkhuniyaḥ sambādhe lomam saharāpessanti iti pe

Private parts:
